title: I don't feel outplayed most the time when I die to a Lee Sin
body:
It honestly feels like dying to Syndra after she misses everything else but still kills you with ult.
It's not that she's better.
It's not that she's good.
It's just her kit makes that kind of shit possible,

And I feel the exact same against Lee.

I realise balance shouldn't be dictated emotionally, but surely there's a point where being killed by, for lack of a better term, total bullshit, would factor into things?

I don't see why he needs so much extra power.
I could probably honestly deal with his horseshit damage - even the ult-q 1shot combo - if I knew I could at least kill him first.
But no, he has ward hopping, 350ms, synergises with simply FARRRRRRRRRRRRRR too many items, and for some stupid reason, gets away with building 1/2 tank, yet accomplishing both.

I ban this fucker every chance I get, and every game he isnt, I spend at least 20 minutes contemplating lobotomy via a ballpoint.

replies.body:
My problem with Lee is that he has a lot of decision making, but anything he decides to do will ALWAYS be on his terms.  

He wants to fight you?  He can do that whenever he'd like with his Q, ward hopping or dashing to minions.  He starts losing the fight?  He just kicks you away and retreats, or lurks outside of your range to pick another engage and finishes you off.

Pretty much, not to mention they have been very generous with the mark duration on his Q.
3 seconds is far too long, 1.5 would be infinitely better. Either that or have the cooldown start after 2nd Q, not the 1st. Or shit, just do both.
Make it like Leona's E! You hit the Q... you're going in! >:3

Same reason why people hate riven, yasuo. 
They have all  the tools to outplay you and the tools to denying you any chance of outplaying them.
What a glorious feeling it was right now as swain to just walk yasuo to death in my ult watching him desperately trying to get to minions to get away. 
I hope he learned something and never picks him again into swain.

A hundred times this. Riot talks about how they want their champions to feel interactive - and Lee is anything but. You don't play against Lee. Lee plays against you however the hell he wants, and maybe - just maybe if he fucks up you get a say in the matter. And he still has 3 ways to disengage, so said fuckup has to be beyond colossal.

You've worded the reason he's annoying better than i ever could.

Lee's going to be my perma-ban until they rework him.

He should be permabanned in a couple weeks when his new skin is released.

Enjoy it while it lasts.

Correlating Syndra hate to Lee Sin hate for that double-dip circlejerk benefit, an interesting play.

If Syndra's ultimate by itself kills you, she's either very fed, you're very behind, and/or a measure of the two plus no defensive itemization. In most practical scenarios early/mid game, she cannot do that without the prior statements being true. Late game she may punch through carry defenses if they only have one item with just her ultimate, depending on what type of defense it is. Hexdrinker/Negatron mean nothing at that point, though Maw of Malmortius may stop her, Abyssal Scepter (lacking the shield of Maw) also doesn't really stand up by itself. When combined with two or more defensive items (Mercurial, GA/Banshee, etc), it gets a lot less feasible for her to do.

[But hey, what do I know](https://www.reddit.com/r/summonerschool/comments/5cuxlk/is_there_even_counterplay_to_syndra_now/da00c3p/)

Lee feels like a champ that every time I "outplay" him, it feels more like he just wasn't good. A good Lee Sin will curb stomp so hard, that he has little issues. Riot always says, "Well he has a lot of play out play potential." The issue with that is say one champion has one out play option, like one stun, a second champ has two out plays, a stun and a dash, and a third has three, a stun, dash, and a displacement. Champ three, if played well will always win because he simply outlasts the enemy with more outplay options. You literally "outplay" them until they have nothing left and are too spent to stop you killing them.
Yasuo falls into the same boat.
He should have the lowest base movement speed, since he has 2 low cooldown dashes.
